title: Ticket #2261: dprintf() not outputting for condor_preen
description:
According to documentation condor tools are expected to emit dprintf() log messages to stderr:

http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/3_3Configuration.html#15993

However, dprintf() calls from condor_preen (and other tools?) don't appear to be output anywhere.

This can be made extra clear by applying the attached patch "preen_dprintf_test.patch", which should output: 

$ condor_preen
right before my dprintf test
EJE: testing dprintf, yo
right after my dprintf test

However, it actually only outputs this: 

$ condor_preen
right before my dprintf test
right after my dprintf test
remarks:
2011-Jun-21 16:15:14 by jrt:
It's missing dprintf_config ("TOOL");

and needs config like

TOOL_DEBUG = D_ALL TOOL_LOG = /var/log/condor/tool.log

2011-Jun-21 17:15:37 by eje:
repro/test:

to repro, invoke condor_preen with no pool running (will cause dprintf() to be invoked in the code) 

# With no pool running
$ condor_preen -debug
Usage: condor_preen [-mail] [-remove] [-verbose]

After fix, -debug properly allows dprintf() output to stderr: 

# With no pool running
$ condor_preen -debug
06/21/11 15:09:31 Reading from /proc/cpuinfo

derived_tickets: #2060   Enhance condor_preen output
attachments:
• gt2261-preen-dprintf.patch 410 bytes added by eje on 2011-Jun-21 22:11:26 UTC.
    Patch to enable condor_preen to adhere to convention that -debug causes dprintf() logging to stderr.
